perturbation.original_text: 6. Intellectual Property. (a) Ownership of Intellectual Property. (i) Company will create and provide to Reed's the Deliverables. Reed's will exclusively own all Deliverables. Company will and hereby does, without further consideration, irrevocably assign to Reed's any and all worldwide right, title or interest that Company may now or hereafter possess in or to the Deliverables in perpetuity (or the maximum period permitted by Applicable Laws and Regulations) and Reed's accepts such assignment. Company will execute and deliver documents reasonably requested by Reed's to register its Intellectual Property in the Deliverables.
perturbation.changed_text: 6. Intellectual Property. (a) Ownership of Intellectual Property. (i) Company will create and provide to Reed's the Deliverables. Reed's will exclusively own all Deliverables. Company will and hereby does, without further consideration, irrevocably assign to Reed's any and all worldwide right, title or interest that Company may now or hereafter possess in or to the Deliverables for a period of ten (10) years, after which the rights revert to Company, and Reed's accepts such assignment. Company will execute and deliver documents reasonably requested by Reed's to register its Intellectual Property in the Deliverables.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states Reed's will exclusively own all Deliverables in perpetuity. The changed text limits Reed's ownership to a period of ten years, after which the rights revert to Company, creating a direct contradiction regarding the duration of ownership.

perturbation.original_text: 7. Confidentiality. Each of Reed's and Company (a "Receiving Party") shall hold in confidence and not make any commercial or other use of any or all Confidential Information conveyed, acquired or learned from the other party (the "Disclosing Party") at any time, except in association with this Agreement. Except as otherwise expressly permitted herein, Receiving Party shall not disclose such information to third persons without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party. Receiving Party shall limit access to the Confidential Information to those of its directors, officers, employees, contractors, agents, attorneys and accountants (the "Representatives") with the need to know the same and shall advise such Representatives of, and hold them to, Receiving Party's obligations under the terms of this Section 7.
perturbation.changed_text: 7. Confidentiality. Each of Reed's and Company (a "Receiving Party") shall hold in confidence and not make any commercial or other use of any or all Confidential Information conveyed, acquired or learned from the other party (the "Disclosing Party") at any time, except in association with this Agreement. Notwithstanding the above, Receiving Party may disclose such information to third persons without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party for purposes of securing investment or financing. Receiving Party shall limit access to the Confidential Information to those of its directors, officers, employees, contractors, agents, attorneys and accountants (the "Representatives") with the need to know the same and shall advise such Representatives of, and hold them to, Receiving Party's obligations under the terms of this Section 7.
perturbation.explanation: The original text strictly prohibits disclosure of confidential information to third persons without prior written consent. The modified text introduces an exception allowing disclosure for investment/financing purposes, creating a contradiction regarding the extent of confidentiality obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 8. Term; Termination. (a) Term. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for the longer of the first anniversary of the Effective Date or the duration of the Manufacturing and Distribution Agreement (the "Term"). The Term may be extended by written agreement of the parties. (b) Early Termination. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time if any of the following occur: (i) the other party fails to comply with any requirements or obligations under this Agreement, and such non-compliance is not cured within 30 days following written notice from the other party identifying the non-compliance; (ii) the other party becomes insolvent, reorganizes or liquidates; (iii) the other party makes any assignment for the benefit of Company's creditors; or (iv) a receiver is appointed for Company's property.
perturbation.changed_text: 8. Term; Termination. (a) Term. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for the longer of the first anniversary of the Effective Date or the duration of the Manufacturing and Distribution Agreement (the "Term"). The Term may be extended by written agreement of the parties. (b) Early Termination. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time and for any reason with 30 days written notice. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time if any of the following occur: (i) the other party fails to comply with any requirements or obligations under this Agreement, and such non-compliance is not cured within 30 days following written notice from the other party identifying the non-compliance; (ii) the other party becomes insolvent, reorganizes or liquidates; (iii) the other party makes any assignment for the benefit of Company's creditors; or (iv) a receiver is appointed for Company's property.
perturbation.explanation: The original text limits early termination to specific events. The inserted sentence in the modified text allows termination at any time for any reason with 30 days written notice, which contradicts the subsequent clause that outlines specific scenarios for early termination. Now it is not clear what is the real term.
